game.gameObject.physics

Interface Movable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>, GameObject
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Collidable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Ball, BreakOut_Ball, Brick, Building, Camera, House, Pad, Racket, Score, Sprite, TestInputSprite, TestSprite

    public interface Movable
extends GameObject
    The movable interface is implemented to provide movement related functions.
    Movement is controlled by a timer witch calls the update function and provides the time that passed in between the last update and the current one.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Julius Häger

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getDX()
      Returns the current dynamic x (X-axis movement) of the movable.
      float getDY()
      Returns the current dynamic y (Y-axis movement) of the movable.

      Returns the current x value of the Movable
      float getY()
      Returns the current y value of the Movable

      Used to set the dynamic x (X-axis movement) of the movable.
      void setDY(float dy)
      Used to set the dynamic y (Y-axis movement) of the movable.

      Sets the current x value of the Movable
      void setY(float y)
      Sets the current y value of the Movable
      void update(long timeMillis)
      Used to update the movement based on the time passed since the last update.

      • getDX

        float getDX()
        Returns the current dynamic x (X-axis movement) of the movable.
        Dynamic x is measured in pixels per second.
        Returns:
        the current dynamic x (X-axis movement)

      • getDY

        float getDY()
        Returns the current dynamic y (Y-axis movement) of the movable.
        Dynamic y is measured in pixels per second.
        Returns:
        the current dynamic y (Y-axis movement)

        Used to set the dynamic x (X-axis movement) of the movable.
        Dynamic x is measured in pixels per second.

      • setDY

        void setDY(float dy)
        Used to set the dynamic y (Y-axis movement) of the movable.
        Dynamic y is measured in pixels per second.
        Parameters:
        dy -

      • update

        void update(long timeMillis)

        Used to update the movement based on the time passed since the last update.

        Note:
        Should be implemented so that the Dynamic x and y equal to pixels per second.

        Parameters:
        timeMillis - time since last update (in milliseconds)
